result.execSummary:
The defendant Kirt Douglas Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. . 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  To make regular monthly payments. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Consecutive to: Consecutive with any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain fulltime employment, school, or a combination of both.  Defendant can also be in a job training program as referred by agent.

No alcohol.  No controlled substances without a valid prescription.  
No association with known drug users or delaers.  No contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
Pay all supervision fees, to make regular payments.

AODA assessment.  Satisfactorily any recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random drug tests.  defendant shall be tested twice per month for the first year; and then be tested once per month randomly.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a  DNA sample to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt: Original transcript (65 pages) commencing PLEA AND SENTENCING HEARING 10/31/2014. Received and Filed.
NO REPLY FROM SURETY/DEFENDANT
NO REPLY SURETY/DEFENDANT.
NO REPLY FROM SURETY OR DEFENDANT.
Defendant's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.
Surety's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($400 = $350 + $50) ad

Defendant Kirt Douglas Davis in court with attorney Benjamin J Peirce.  Defendant Kirt Douglas Davis in custody.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    

Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  

AS TO THE AMENDED INFORMATION:

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  3 YEARS, 6 MONTHS, CONSECUTIVE with any other sentence, with credit for 146 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  The defendant IS ELIGIBLE for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program and IS NOT ELIGIBLE for the Challenge Incarceration Program. 

The Court imposed the following conditions of extended supervision:  

- AODA assessment and satisfactorily comply any recommended treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests.  Defendant shall be tested twice per month for the first year, and then be tested once per month, randomly.  
- Seek and maintain full time employment, school, or a combination of both.  Defendant can also be in a job training program, as referred by agent.
- No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample, and to pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, assessments, and surcharges through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
- Pay all supervision fees.  Defendant to make regular payments.

Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.  aw

Received and filed.  aw

Count 1:  Possession of cocaine- 2nd and subsequent offense, contrary to WI Stat sec. 961.41(3g)(c), 939.50(3)(i).  A class I felony.
Speedy trial demand, received and filed.  aw
All other conditions remains the same.  aw
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.

Defendant Kirt Douglas Davis in court with attorney Benjamin J Peirce.  Defendant Kirt Douglas Davis in custody.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has filed a motion for a speedy trial demand.  Defendant wishes to resolve the case on the next court date, and does not wish to have a trial date.  Court held colloquy with defendant.  Court takes no action.  Case remains scheduled for plea and sentencing on 10/31/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw
Defense request for a motion hearing date for motion to enter speedy trial is approved.

Attorney Benjamin J Peirce in court, defendant Kirt Douglas Davis not in court, in custody.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Court feels cash bail is appropriately set.  Next court date remains.  aw

Attorney Benjamin J Peirce in court, defendant Kirt Douglas Davis not in court, in custody.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 10/31/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Peirce has just been appointed.  Defendant filed a bail bond motion.  Defense requests court disregard what was filed.  Defense can argue bail on the next court date.  Case adjourned for bail bond hearing and scheduling conference on 8/25/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Letter from the defendant, and Pro Se motion to reduce bail, received and filed.  aw

Defendant Kirt Douglas Davis in court with attorney Amy Catherine Scholz.  Defendant Kirt Douglas Davis in custody.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Scholz informs court that there has been a breakdown in communication that is irreconcilable.  Defendant agreed to work with new counsel.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Attorney Scholz is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed.  Case is adjourned for status of counsel to 7/21/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Notice of motion and motion to withdraw as counsel of record, received and filed.  aw

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for INTENSIVE Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of any  controlled substances without a valid prescription.
